info.description: Upload or Retreive Custom Evaluation Metric to be used for Rule evaluation in Risk Radar.
info.title: Risk Governance - Custom Evaluation Metric

get.description: Retrieve custom evaluation metric matching the parameters provided.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
When provided, retrieves custom evaluation metric as they appeared at the specified point in time, expressed in UTC.  
If absent, the current UTC server time will be used instead and custom evaluation metric will be returned on an as-is rather than as-was basis.
parameters.name: reportTime

parameters.description:
When provided, retrieves historical custom evaluation metric records with business validity after the specified date (exclusive). 
This parameter is used in conjunction with the endRangeDate parameter, typically to retrieve a time series of custom evaluation metric records.  
This time series is uses as-is Metric - combining date range parameters with the reportTime parameter is not supported.
parameters.name: beginRangeDate

parameters.description:
When provided, retrieves historical custom evaluation metric records with business validity up to and including the specified date (inclusive).
This parameter is used in conjunction with the beginRangeDate parameter, typically to retrieve a time series of custom evaluation metric records.
This time series is uses as-is Metric - combining date range parameters with the reportTime parameter is not supported.
parameters.name: endRangeDate

parameters.description:
A field mask to restrict which fields on the custom evaluation metric are returned. 
By default, all fields of the custom evaluation metric are returned. 
Field names should be specified in camelCase. 
In addition to the fields specified, the response will contain scopeId, scopeType, entityId, entityType.
parameters.name: readMask

parameters.description: The offset value used to set the starting point into the result set found at the repository.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description:
The number of entries to be returned as a response
The maximum value is 1000. If unspecified, the default value is 5.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Used to provide with https://google.aip.dev/160 filtering capabilities.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description:
Used to provide with ordering to the returned entries. The supported syntax (for now):
[target field]:asc or [target field]:desc.
parameters.name: orderBy

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

v1BatchQueryRiskCustomEvaluationMetricsM.title: Metadata for latest custom evaluation metric request

v1BatchQueryRiskCustomEvaluationMetricsR.title: Request for the latest custom evaluation metric
Response for the latest custom evaluation metric request

results.title: Custom metric query result for requested search query

v1CreateRiskCustomEvaluationMetricReques.title: Submit custom evaluation metric API payload

asOfDate.title:
The effective date for the custom evaluation metric record being submitted. The expected format is yyyy-MM-dd
(-- api-linter: core::0133::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this information defines the point in time where the risk was identified --)

riskCustomEvaluationMetric.description: The custom evaluation metric record being submitted to create or update an existing custom evaluation metric.

v1CreateRiskCustomEvaluationMetricResult.title: Risk custom evaluation metric create result

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

v1ListRiskCustomEvaluationMetricResponse.title: Response for the List custom evaluation metric requests

riskCustomEvaluationMetrics.title: Custom metric search result for requested search criteria

total.title: The total number of metric records matching the requested criteria

nextPageToken.description:
A token that can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1LongrunningOperation.description:
LongrunningOperation represents a long-running operation that is the result
of a network API call.

id.description:
The server-assigned id, which is only unique within the same service that
originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the
`id` should have the format of `operations/some/unique/id`.

meta.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation.  It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata.  Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If true, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success.  If the original
method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is
`google.protobuf.Empty`.  If the original method is standard
`Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource.  For other
methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx`
is the original method name.  For example, if the original method name
is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is
`TakeSnapshotResponse`.

v1MetricValue.title: Metric value is one of Integer or Double value

v1QueryRiskCustomEvaluationMetricRequest.title: Message for querying latest custom evaluation metric

scopeId.title:
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api --)
The unique identifier of the scope of the custom evaluation metric. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portoflio code

scopeType.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api within same domain. --)
The scope of the custom evaluation metric e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

entityId.title:
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api within same domain. --)
The unique identifier of the entity the custom evaluation metric refers to. E.g. for an issuer, this should be the issuer code

entityType.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api within same domain. --)
Used to determine the type of entity the custom evaluation metric refers to, e.g. one of 
'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'SECTOR', 'FACTOR', 'ISSUER', 'SECURITY', 'OTHER'

metric.title: name for the custom evaluation metric, metric referencing to onboarded custom metric config

asOfDate.description: The effective date for the custom evaluation metric record being pulled.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

v1RiskCustomEvaluationMetric.description:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because all analytics oversight gevernance apis are following this standard only --)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api --)
Representation of Risk custom evaluation metric, its available fields  to store more specific details.

id.title: Unique identifier for the data record

validBeginDate.description: The date on which the custom evaluation metric record is valid.

validEndDate.title: The date at which the custom evaluation metric record stops being valid, e.g. it is superseded by a new record on the following day

entryTime.title: The timestamp when the record entered the system

expiryTime.title: The INTERNAL timestamp when the record expires

modifier.title: Identifies the modifier of the custom evaluation metric

scopeId.title:
The unique identifier of the scope of the custom evaluation metric. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portoflio code
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is inline with risk exception api --)

scopeType.title: The scope of the custom evaluation metric e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

scope.title: The name of the scope, e.g. the porfolio name

entityId.title: The unique identifier of the entity the custom evaluation metric refers to. E.g. for an issuer, this should be the issuer code

entityType.title:
Used to determine the type of entity the custom evaluation metric refers to, e.g. one of 
'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'SECTOR', 'FACTOR', 'ISSUER', 'SECURITY', 'OTHER'

entity.title: The name of the entity that the custom evaluation metric is concerned with

metricCategory.title: category for the custom evaluation metric

metric.title: name for the custom evaluation metric, metric referencing to onboarded custom metric config

riskMetricValue.title: value for the custom evaluation metric

v1UploadRiskCustomEvaluationMetricsMetaD.title:
MetaMetric for longrunning operation on create risk custom evaluation metric
Currently it is not possible to determine progress, but it may be possible in the future

v1UploadRiskCustomEvaluationMetricsReque.title: Bulk Create custom evaluation metric API payload

requests.description: Risk custom evaluation metric record being submitted to create or update an existing custom evaluation metric.

v1UploadRiskCustomEvaluationMetricsRespo.title: Bulk Create custom evaluation metric results

results.title: Bulk Create custom evaluation metric results

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
